duties_responsibilities.duty: Operate and maintain line equipment to support production and quality targets and requirements.
Participate in continuous improvement activities to improve line safety, efficiency, quality, and cost targets.
Perform routine preventive and predictive maintenance tasks, identify and perform corrective work with documentation in CMMS.
Repair, maintain, and install robots and robotic systems including all application/field equipment utilized in the systems.
Troubleshoot problems and programs a variety of Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC), using appropriate tools/equipment (computers, hand held tools, systems, etc.).
Determine the type and size of pipe and /or conduit as well as related materials according to job specifications.
Plan and oversee participation in industry events, conferences, and trade shows to showcase services and network with potential clients.
Replace motor and gearboxes, including reconnection of main power wires at motor terminals.
Analyze failures and report with recommended countermeasures; document relevant data in appropriate system.

education_certification.credential: Two (2) year technical degree from a certified Trade School or Technical College in Industrial Electronics/Electrical fields plus three (3) years of maintenance experience in an industrial manufacturing environment.
